welcome.introText1: Kilo Code is a free, open source AI coding agent.
welcome.introText2: It works with the latest AI models like Claude 4 Sonnet, Gemini 2.5 Pro, GPT-4.1, and 450+ more.
welcome.introText3: Create a free account and get $20 worth of tokens to use across any AI model.

lowCreditWarning.lowBalance: Your Kilo Code balance is low

pricing.costUnknownDescription: The API Provider did not provide any cost data or the request was canceled.
pricing.freeModelsDescription: Free models may have rate limits. Use the link below to optimize your free model usage!
pricing.freeModelsLink: Discover free and budget model options

providerRouting.title: Kilo Code - OpenRouter Provider Routing
providerRouting.description: Kilo Code routes requests to the best available providers for your model. By default, requests are load balanced across the top providers to maximize uptime. However, you can choose a specific provider to use for this model.

provider.automaticFetch: The latest models are automatically available in Kilo Code. If you're unsure which model to choose, Kilo Code works best with the recommended models listed at the top in bold face.

modelInfo.averageKiloCodeCostDescription: This is the average actual spent for Kilo Code using this model over the last week. It may be lower than the listed price due to prompt cache utilization.

table.context: The endpoint can process this number of tokens (input + output).
table.inputPrice: Cost per million tokens for the prompt.
table.outputPrice: Cost per million tokens for the completion.
table.cacheReadPrice: Cost per million tokens for reading from the cache.
table.cacheWritePrice: Cost per million tokens for writing to the cache.

allowVeryLargeReads.label: Allow very large file reads
allowVeryLargeReads.description: When enabled, Kilo Code will perform very large file or MCP output reads even if there is a high chance of overflowing the context window (content size >80% of context window).

systemNotifications.label: Enable System Notifications
systemNotifications.description: When enabled, Kilo Code will send system notifications for important events like task completion or errors.
systemNotifications.testMessage: This is a test notification from Kilo Code.

apiConfigId.label: API Configuration
apiConfigId.description: Select which API configuration to use for generating terminal commands. Leave as 'Use Current Configuration' to use your default settings.

condense.wantsToCondense: Kilo Code wants to condense your conversation

description.rules: Rules allow you to provide Kilo Code with instructions it should follow in all modes and for all prompts. They are a persistent way to include context and preferences for all conversations in your workspace or globally.
description.workflows: Workflows are a prepared template for a conversation. Workflows can allow you to define prompts you use frequently, and can include a series of steps to guide Kilo Code through repetitive tasks, such as deploying a service or submitting a PR. To invoke a workflow, type

validation.invalidFileExtension: Only .md, .txt, or no file extension allowed

ideaSuggestionsBox.suggestionText: <suggestionButton>Click here</suggestionButton> for a cool idea, then tap on <sendIcon /> and watch me do magic!

ideas.idea1: Make a spinning, glowing 3D sphere that responds to mouse movements. Make the app work in the browser.
ideas.idea2: Create a portfolio website for a Python software developer
ideas.idea3: Create a financial app mockup in the browser. Then test if it works
ideas.idea4: Create a directory website containing the best AI video generation models currently
ideas.idea5: Create a CSS gradient generator that exports custom stylesheets and shows a live preview
ideas.idea6: Generate cards that reveal dynamic content beautifully when hovered over
ideas.idea7: Create a calming interactive starfield that moves with mouse gestures

settings.keybindingDescription: Inline Assist features are triggered by commands. You can configure the <DocsLink>Keyboard Shortcuts here</DocsLink>.

enableAutoTrigger.label: Enable Auto Trigger
enableAutoTrigger.description: When enabled, Kilo Code will automatically trigger Inline Assist when you stop typing. This can be useful for quick fixes and suggestions.

autoTriggerDelay.label: Auto Trigger Delay
autoTriggerDelay.description: The delay in seconds before Kilo Code triggers Inline Assist after you stop typing. A shorter delay means quicker suggestions, but may be more resource-intensive.

enableQuickInlineTaskKeybinding.label: Quick Inline Task
enableQuickInlineTaskKeybinding.description: Only need a quick change? Select some code (or don't!) and hit Cmd+I. Describe your goal in plain English ("create a React component with these props", "add error handling to this function"), and get multiple, ready-to-use suggestions right in your editor. <DocsLink>See shortcut</DocsLink>

enableSmartInlineTaskKeybinding.label: Smart Inline Task
enableSmartInlineTaskKeybinding.description: Need a quick fix, completion, or refactor? Kilo will use the surrounding context to offer immediate improvements, keeping you in the flow. <DocsLink>See shortcut</DocsLink>

apiConfigId.label: API Configuration
apiConfigId.description: Select an API configuration to use for Inline Assist prompts, or just use whatever is currently selected

virtualProvider.title: Virtual Quota Fallback Provider Settings
virtualProvider.description: Configure a list of profiles each with their own quota limits. When one provider's quota limits are reached, the next profile in the list will be used until none remain.
virtualProvider.noProfilesAvailable: No profile profiles available. Please configure at least one non-virtual provider profile first.
virtualProvider.dangerZoneDescription: These actions are destructive and cannot be undone.
virtualProvider.confirmClearDescription: This will permanently delete all stored usage data for virtual providers. This action cannot be undone.
